barker_notes.barker_summary: Sugar shipped from New Orleans to Philadelphia on account of Kaskaskia merchant.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 1, pp. 79

div1.p: Sugar shipped from New Orleans to Philadelphia on account of Kaskaskia merchant.
Sales of 13 Hhds Muscovado Sugar Shipt by John F. Merieult Esqr. New Orleans on board the Schooner Nancy John Smith Masr. for account of Doctor George Fisher Kaskaskea—
Sepr 9th William Rogers at 75 days credit. 13 Hhds- Wt______135 0 27 Tr 12 pc__________14 1 27 120 3 0 V iz $9. Pct________________1086. 75

Charges V[iz] Bonds at Custom House___________ $1. Duty____________________________ 333. Freight and primage_____________ 204. 75 Ditto from Lazeretto____________ 6. 50 Cooperage_______________________ 4. 47 Porterage_______________________ 4. 33 Advertising_____________________ 2. 33 Custom House charge for weighing_ 1. 35 Commission 5 pct________________ 54.33
Errors and outstanding Debts Excepted Philadelphia, 31st Octor.
